comment: The teacher was straightforward, always willing to help if you didn't understand something, and gave out extra credit before exams if you got questions right. Would take again 100%.
He is a very lenient grader and gives you extra credit tests, however, he does not teach. He only reads the PowerPoint and assigns homework so not a lot of practice.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Took him twice. He gives out 20 free bonus points on every test, even the department final. So you can literally get a 70 (-30 points) and you'll actually get a 90 because he just adds 20 points for no reason. He's also a good teacher in general.

He's overall a really good and fairly easy professor. He grades tests out of 120, so basically you get a free 20 points. He'll give 5 points of extra credit to the next test if you answer questions in class. The only thing is he goes a little slow and can repeat himself, but he's a great professor for the class nonetheless!

While the lectures are boring, I would recommend going to every lecture to get extra credit (which saved my grade). The class is still challenging and but he makes the tests easy if you've done the homework. Still a good professor and very understanding.

His lectures are boring and long. He didn't make the slide show, nor the homework. He makes is own tests(except for the final), which are super easy. He gives a two letter grade curve on every single test. The final is worth 35% of the grade though. He did not make it. It was a 25 question multiple choice test. You may need outside help to get an A
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Chill and knowledgeable professor who makes learning easy for students. His lectures are well put together and he has a vocation for teaching. Lectures are not boring and explains things thoroughly with very practical examples right after each module. In my experience I would recommend him for any civil engineering class he is teaching.

Exams and quizzes were mostly based on questions from class/HW. Allowed to make your own formula sheet for exams except for the final, and midterms are graded out of 120 with max 100 points, so you get 20 extra points for each exam (exams usually were ~3 questions). Asks questions in class and will offer extra credit for answers.

Dr. Haddad is a good professor, knowledgeable, and caring. He wants you to understand engineering concepts and not just memorize stuff for test taking. He tries to get you to think and awards a lot of extra credit points for exams and final if you participate in class. Exams are 120 points, but only records up to 100. Think bonus points possible.

He is not a good professor but the class and tests are really easy. will yap about minute details that don't mean anything and if someone doesn't answer a question he will sit in silence until someone gets it right.

I loved this prof. he puts all PowerPoints on d2l, and all homework was on Pearson so no need to wait for a grade. his exams were clear and easy if you do the assignments he gives. he gives random extra credit if you answer his questions correctly(he specifies its an extra credit question.) would absolutely take this prof again

I took his Strength of Materials lecture class and he is a good professor. Sometimes the lectures can be monotone and boring. His test are straight forward and they are usually homework problems. He is a generous grader and curves. Expect to get an A with just a bit of work. If you show up to class and participate he will be easier on you.
